page.title: 17BOMBS AND SCHOOLS
page.content: {BOMBING }Durness lies beside the Cape Wrath bombing range. When the R.A.F. or Navy are using the range (usually in the winter and spring) shock waves come from the explosions which shake the area. Many people have complained about damage to property. A public meeting in 1984 suceeded in reducing the size of the bombs dropped and low flying over the village. {SCHOOLING }Children must go to Dornoch or Golspie 128km away for secondary education. Hostel accomodation is provided from Sunday to Thursday night. Parents are concerned about the social implications of being seperated from their children and the effect this has on their education. Several attempts have been made to get a secondary school for the NW. The most recent(June1985) is for a four year secondary at Kinlochbervie, 29km away.
